description: The focus on dangers posed by AI for U.S. elections this year is understandable, but it might overshadow more mundane ID authentication risks that are nonetheless critical. A poll paid for by authentication hardware vendor Yubico and a federal elections nonprofit advocacy group indicates that 85 percent of respondents lack high confidence that political campaigns can effectively shield their personal data. Michael Kaiser, CEO of Defending Digital Campaigns, a nonprofit supplying free security tools and resour
title: Political campaigns could lose more than donations if they don’t secure their data
